definitions.definition: A long seat with or without a back, found for example in parks and schools.
definitions.example: They sat on a park bench and tossed bread crumbs to the ducks and pigeons.

definitions.definition: The people who decide on the verdict; the judiciary.
definitions.example: They are awaiting a decision on the motion from the bench.

definitions.definition: The place where the judges sit.
definitions.example: She sat on the bench for 30 years before she retired.

definitions.definition: The dignity of holding an official seat.
definitions.example: the bench of bishops

definitions.definition: The place where players (substitutes) and coaches sit when not playing.
definitions.example: He spent the first three games on the bench, watching.

definitions.definition: The number of players on a team able to participate, expressed in terms of length.
definitions.example: Injuries have shortened the bench.

definitions.definition: A place where assembly or hand work is performed; a workbench.
definitions.example: She placed the workpiece on the bench, inspected it closely, and opened the cover.

definitions.definition: A horizontal padded surface, usually adjustable in height and inclination and often with attached weight rack, used for proper posture during exercise.
A bracket used to mount land surveying equipment onto a stone or a wall.
definitions.example: After removing the bench, we can use the mark left on the wall as a reference point.

definitions.definition: A flat ledge in the slope of an earthwork, work of masonry, or similar.
A thin strip of relatively flat land bounded by steeper slopes above and below.
A kitchen surface on which to prepare food, a counter.
A bathroom surface which holds the washbasin, a vanity.
A collection or group of dogs exhibited to the public, traditionally on benches or raised platforms.
To remove a player from play.
definitions.example: They benched him for the rest of the game because they thought he was injured.

definitions.definition: To remove someone from a position of responsibility temporarily.
To push a person backward against a conspirator behind them who is on their hands and knees, causing them to fall over.
To furnish with benches.
To place on a bench or seat of honour.
The weight one is able to bench press, especially the maximum weight capable of being pressed.
definitions.example: He became frustrated when his bench increased by only 10 pounds despite a month of training.

definitions.definition: To lift by bench pressing
definitions.example: I heard he can bench 150 pounds.

definitions.definition: To recite the Birkat Hamazon.
Any external phenomenon that has an influence on a system, by triggering or modifying an internal phenomenon.
definitions.example: an economic stimulus

definitions.definition: Something external that elicits or influences a physiological or psychological activity or response.
Anything effectively impinging upon any of the sensory apparatuses of a living organism, including physical phenomena both internal and external to the body.
Anything that induces a person to take action.
A tendency to expect the best, or at least, a favourable outcome
definitions.example: I love her youth, her beauty and above all her optimism that everything will turn out fine.

definitions.definition: The doctrine that this world is the best of all possible worlds
The belief that good will eventually triumph over evil
A group or bunch of several discrete items that are close to each other.
definitions.example: A cluster of flowers grew in the pot.

definitions.definition: A number of individuals grouped together or collected in one place; a crowd; a mob.
A group of galaxies or stars that appear near each other.
definitions.example: The Pleiades cluster contains seven bright stars.

definitions.definition: A sequence of two or more words that occur in language with high frequency but are not idiomatic; a chunk, bundle, or lexical bundle.
definitions.example: examples of clusters would include "in accordance with", "the results of" and "so far"

definitions.definition: A secundal chord of three or more notes.
A group of consonants.
definitions.example: The word "scrub" begins with a cluster of three consonants.

definitions.definition: A group of computers that work together.
A logical data storage unit containing one or more physical sectors (see block).
A significant subset within a population.
Set of bombs or mines.
A small metal design that indicates that a medal has been awarded to the same person before.
Euphemism of clusterfuck.
An ensemble of bound atoms or molecules, intermediate in size between a molecule and a bulk solid.
To form a cluster or group.
definitions.example: The children clustered around the puppy.

definitions.definition: To collect into clusters.
To cover with clusters.
The point where two components of a structure join, but are still able to rotate.
definitions.example: This rod is free to swing at the joint with the platform.

definitions.definition: The point where two components of a structure join rigidly.
definitions.example: The water is leaking out of the joint between the two pipes.

definitions.definition: Any part of the body where two bones join, in most cases allowing that part of the body to be bent or straightened.
The means of securing together the meeting surfaces of components of a structure.
definitions.example: The dovetail joint, while more difficult to make, is also quite strong.

definitions.definition: A cut of meat.
definitions.example: Set the joint in a roasting tin and roast for the calculated cooking time.

definitions.definition: The part or space included between two joints, knots, nodes, or articulations.
definitions.example: a joint of cane or of a grass stem; a joint of the leg

definitions.definition: A fracture in which the strata are not offset; a geologic joint.
(somewhat derogatory) A place of business, particularly in the food service or hospitality industries.
definitions.example: It was the kind of joint you wouldn't want your boss to see you in.

definitions.definition: (with the definite article) Prison.
definitions.example: I'm just trying to stay out of the joint.

definitions.definition: A marijuana cigarette.
definitions.example: After locking the door and closing the shades, they lit the joint.

definitions.definition: A syringe used to inject an illicit drug.
The penis.
To unite by a joint or joints; to fit together; to prepare so as to fit together
definitions.example: a jointing plane

definitions.definition: To join; to connect; to unite; to combine.
To provide with a joint or joints; to articulate.
To separate the joints; of; to divide at the joint or joints; to disjoint; to cut up into joints, as meat.
To fit as if by joints; to coalesce as joints do.
definitions.example: the stones joint, neatly.

definitions.definition: Done by two or more people or organisations working together.
definitions.example: The play was a joint production between the two companies.

definitions.definition: The expulsion from the womb of a foetus or embryo before it is fully developed, with loss of the foetus; either naturally as a spontaneous abortion (now usually called a miscarriage), or deliberately as an induced abortion.
An aborted foetus; an abortus.
A misshapen person or thing; a monstrosity.
Failure or abandonment of a project, promise, goal etc.
Arrest of development of any organ, so that it remains an imperfect formation or is absorbed.
The cessation of an illness or disease at a very early stage.
A loud, sharp sound as of a cork coming out of a bottle.
definitions.example: Listen to the pop of a champagne cork.

definitions.definition: (Midwest US) An effervescent or fizzy drink, most frequently nonalcoholic; soda pop.
definitions.example: Lunch was sandwiches and a bottle of pop.

definitions.definition: (Midwest US) A bottle, can, or serving of effervescent or fizzy drink, most frequently nonalcoholic; soda pop.
definitions.example: Go in the store and buy us three pops.

definitions.definition: A pop shot: a quick, possibly unaimed, shot with a firearm.
definitions.example: The man with the gun took a pop at the rabbit.

definitions.definition: (in the phrase "a pop") A quantity dispensed, a portion, apiece.
definitions.example: They cost 50 pence a pop.

definitions.definition: Something that stands out or is distinctive, especially to the senses.
definitions.example: a pop of vanilla flavour

definitions.definition: The removal of a data item from the top of a stack.
A bird, the European redwing.
The sixth derivative of the position vector with respect to time (after velocity, acceleration, jerk, jounce, crackle), i.e. the rate of change of crackle.
A pistol.
To make a pop, or sharp, quick sound.
definitions.example: The muskets popped away on all sides.

definitions.definition: To burst (something) with a popping sound.
definitions.example: The boy with the pin popped the balloon.

definitions.definition: (with in, out, upon, etc.) To enter, or issue forth, with a quick, sudden movement; to move from place to place suddenly; to dart.
definitions.example: A rabbit popped out of the hole.

definitions.definition: To place (something) (somewhere); to move or position (something) with a short movement.
definitions.example: He popped his head around the door.

definitions.definition: (often with over, round, along, etc.) To make a short trip or visit.
definitions.example: I'll pop by your place later today.

definitions.definition: To stand out; to be distinctive to the senses.
definitions.example: This colour really pops.

definitions.definition: To hit (something or someone).
definitions.example: He popped me on the nose.

definitions.definition: To shoot (usually somebody) with a firearm.
To ejaculate.
To remove (a data item) from the top of a stack.
To remove a data item from the top of (a stack).
To pawn (something) (to raise money).
definitions.example: I had to pop my watch to see me through until pay-day.

definitions.definition: To swallow or consume (especially a tablet of a drug, sometimes extended to other small items such as sweets or candy).
To perform (a move or stunt) while riding a board or vehicle.
(of the ears) To undergo equalization of pressure when the Eustachian tubes open.
definitions.example: My ears popped as the aeroplane began to ascend.

definitions.definition: Used to represent a loud, sharp sound, as of a cork coming out of a bottle.
Affectionate form of father.
definitions.example: My pop used to tell me to do my homework every night.

definitions.definition: Pop music.
(used attributively in set phrases) Popular.
(Russian Orthodoxy) A Russian Orthodox priest; a parson.
A wooden band or yoke put around the neck of an ox or cow in the stall.
A pond or pool; a dirty pond of standing water.
To pull by the ears; to pull about; haul; lug.
Only
Unmarried (especially of a woman); widowed.
The bottom or plantar surface of the foot.
(footwear) The bottom of a shoe or boot.
The foot itself.
Solea solea, a flatfish of the family Soleidae.
The bottom or lower part of anything, or that on which anything rests in standing.
The seat or bottom of a mine; applied to horizontal veins or lodes.
To put a sole on (a shoe or boot)
A young person.
To introduce (something) as a reasoned conclusion; to conclude by reasoning or deduction, as from premises or evidence.
To lead to (something) as a consequence; to imply. (Now often considered incorrect, especially with a person as subject.)
To cause, inflict (something) upon or to someone.
To introduce (a subject) in speaking, writing etc.; to bring in.
Mode of rule or management.
definitions.example: a prison regime

definitions.definition: A form of government, or the government in power.
definitions.example: a capitalist regime

definitions.definition: A period of rule.
A regulated system; a regimen.
definitions.example: Heaven will eliminate the tyrannical regimes.

definitions.definition: A division of a Mafia crime family, led by a caporegime.
A set of characteristics.
definitions.example: A typical annual water level regime would include a gradual summer drawdown beginning in early May.

definitions.definition: To cause to be, to bring into existence; to produce, initiate.
To come into existence; to have origin or beginning; to spring, be derived (from, with).
definitions.example: The scheme originated with the governor and council.

definitions.definition: Trees in a forest regarded as a source of wood.
(outside North America) Wood that has been pre-cut and is ready for use in construction.
A heavy wooden beam, generally a whole log that has been squared off and used to provide heavy support for something such as a roof.
definitions.example: the timbers of a ship

definitions.definition: Material for any structure.
The wooden stock of a rifle or shotgun.
A certain quantity of fur skins (as of martens, ermines, sables, etc.) packed between boards; in some cases forty skins, in others one hundred and twenty. Also timmer, timbre.
To fit with timbers.
definitions.example: timbering a roof

definitions.definition: To construct, frame, build.
To light or land on a tree.
To make a nest.
To surmount as a timber does.
Used by loggers to warn others that a tree being felled is falling.
A producer or director of films/movies.
Something extra that is good; an added benefit.
An extra sum given as a premium, e.g. to an employee or to a shareholder.
definitions.example: The employee of the week receives a bonus for his excellent work.

definitions.definition: An addition to the player's score based on performance, e.g. for time remaining.
One or more free throws awarded to a team when the opposing team has accumulated enough fouls.
To pay a bonus, premium
Something that impedes, stands in the way of, or holds up progress
definitions.example: A big obstacle to understanding the manual was that it had been poorly translated from the Japanese.

definitions.definition: A place where the dead are buried; a graveyard or memorial park.
The act of implicating.
The state of being implicated.
(usually in the plural) A possible effect or result of a decision or action.
definitions.example: There are serious implications for the environment of such reforms.

definitions.definition: An implying, or that which is implied, but not expressed; an inference, or something which may fairly be understood, though not expressed in words.
The connective in propositional calculus that, when joining two predicates A and B in that order, has the meaning "if A is true, then B is true".
Logical consequence.
Having sufficient skill, knowledge, ability, or qualifications.
definitions.example: He is a competent skier and an expert snowboarder.

definitions.definition: Having jurisdiction or authority over a particular issue or question.
definitions.example: For any disagreements arising from this contract, the competent court shall be the Springfield Circuit Court.

definitions.definition: Adequate for the purpose
(of a cell wall) Permeable to foreign DNA.
Resistant to deformation or flow.
The act or practice of robbing.
The offense of taking or attempting to take the property of another by force or threat of force.
The act of restricting, or the state of being restricted.
A regulation or limitation that restricts.
The mechanism by which a cell degrades foreign DNA material.
One who administers affairs; one who directs, manages, executes, or dispenses, whether in civil, judicial, political, or ecclesiastical affairs; a manager
A person who manages or settles the estate of an intestate, or of a testator when there is no competent executor; one to whom the right of administration has been committed by competent authority
One who is responsible for software installation, management, information and maintenance of a computer or network
Rule by the people, especially as a form of government; either directly or through elected representatives (representative democracy).
A government under the direct or representative rule of the people of its jurisdiction.
Belief in political freedom and equality; the "spirit of democracy".
To assign or be assigned a particular rank or level.
definitions.example: She is rated fourth in the country.

definitions.definition: To evaluate or estimate the value of.
definitions.example: They rate his talents highly.

definitions.definition: To consider or regard.
definitions.example: He rated this book brilliant.

definitions.definition: To deserve; to be worth.
definitions.example: The view here hardly rates a mention in the travel guide.

definitions.definition: To determine the limits of safe functioning for a machine or electrical device.
definitions.example: The transformer is rated at 10 watts.

definitions.definition: To evaluate a property's value for the purposes of local taxation.
To like; to think highly of.
definitions.example: The customers don't rate the new burgers.

definitions.definition: To have position (in a certain class).
definitions.example: He rates as the best cyclist in the country.

definitions.definition: To have value or standing.
definitions.example: This last performance of hers didn't rate very high with the judges.

definitions.definition: To ratify.
To ascertain the exact rate of the gain or loss of (a chronometer) as compared with true time.
To berate, scold.
A position on a scale
An evaluation of status, especially of financial status
definitions.example: They have a poor credit rating.

definitions.definition: A number, letter, or other mark that refers to the ability of something.
definitions.example: He has a high chess rating.

definitions.definition: A seaman in a warship
The status of a seaman, corresponding to rank in officers.
Of or pertaining to the near or immediate future.
definitions.example: This short-term plan deals with the next few days.

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to a short duration of time
definitions.example: short-term exposure

definitions.definition: Agreement or accord.
A pleasing combination of elements, or arrangement of sounds.
The academic study of chords.
Two or more notes played simultaneously to produce a chord.
The relationship between two distinct musical pitches (musical pitches being frequencies of vibration which produce audible sound) played simultaneously.
A literary work which brings together or arranges systematically parallel passages of historians respecting the same events, and shows their agreement or consistency.
definitions.example: a harmony of the Gospels

definitions.definition: To disappoint or defeat; to vex by depriving of something expected or desired.
definitions.example: It frustrates me to do all this work and then lose it all.

definitions.definition: To hinder or thwart.
definitions.example: My clumsy fingers frustrate my typing efforts.

definitions.definition: To cause stress or annoyance.
definitions.example: This test frustrates me because if I fail, it'll destroy my grade.

definitions.definition: Foiled, stopped, disappointed.
Suffering from frustration; dissatisfied, agitated, and/or discontent because one is unable to perform an action or fulfill a desire.
The main bones of the head considered as a unit; including the cranium, facial bones, and mandible.
A symbol for death; death's-head
The mind or brain.
A crust formed on the ladle, etc. by the partial cooling of molten metal.
The crown of the headpiece in armour.
A shallow bow-handled basket.
To hit in the head with a fist, a weapon, or a thrown object.
To strike the top of (the ball).
(collective) A group of fish or a group of marine mammals such as porpoises, dolphins, or whales.
definitions.example: The divers encountered a huge school of mackerel.

definitions.definition: A multitude.
Any large piece of timber or iron long in proportion to its thickness, and prepared for use.

One of the principal horizontal timbers of a building; one of the transverse members of a ship's frame on which the decks are laid — supported at the sides by knees in wooden ships and by stringers in steel ones.
The maximum width of a vessel (note that a vessel with a beam of 15 foot can also be said to be 15 foot abeam)
definitions.example: This ship has more beam than that one.

definitions.definition: The crossbar of a mechanical balance, from the ends of which the scales are suspended.
The principal stem of the antler of a deer.
The pole of a carriage or chariot.
A cylinder of wood, making part of a loom, on which weavers wind the warp before weaving and the cylinder on which the cloth is rolled, as it is woven.
The straight part or shank of an anchor.
The central bar of a plow, to which the handles and colter are secured, and to the end of which are attached the oxen or horses that draw it.

In steam engines, a heavy iron lever having an oscillating motion on a central axis, one end of which is connected with the piston rod from which it receives motion, and the other with the crank of the wheel shaft.
A ray or collection of approximately parallel rays emitted from the sun or other luminous body.
definitions.example: a beam of energy

definitions.definition: A ray; a gleam.
definitions.example: a beam of hope, or of comfort

definitions.definition: One of the long feathers in the wing of a hawk.
A horizontal bar which connects the stems of two or more notes to group them and to indicate metric value.
An elevated rectangular dirt pile used to cheaply build an elevated portion of a railway.
To emit beams of light; shine; radiate.
definitions.example: to beam forth light

definitions.definition: To smile broadly or especially cheerfully.
To furnish or supply with beams
To give the appearance of beams to.
To transmit matter or information via a high-tech wireless mechanism.
definitions.example: Beam me up, Scotty; there's no intelligent life down here.

definitions.definition: (currying) To stretch something (for example an animal hide) on a beam.
To put (something) on a beam
To connect (musical notes) with a beam, or thick line, in music notation.
The legal dissolution of a marriage.
definitions.example: Richard obtained a divorce from his wife some years ago, but hasn't returned to the dating scene.

definitions.definition: A separation of connected things.
definitions.example: The Civil War split between Virginia and West Virginia was a divorce based along cultural and economic as well as geographic lines.

definitions.definition: That which separates.
To legally dissolve a marriage between two people.
definitions.example: A ship captain can marry couples, but cannot divorce them.

definitions.definition: To end one's own marriage to (a person) in this way.
definitions.example: Lucy divorced Steve when she discovered that he had been unfaithful.

definitions.definition: To obtain a legal divorce.
definitions.example: Edna and Simon divorced last year; he got the house, and she retained the business.

definitions.definition: To separate something that was connected.
definitions.example: The radical group voted to divorce itself from the main faction and start an independent movement.

definitions.definition: A cut of meat, often containing a section of a rib.
definitions.example: I only like lamb chops with mint jelly.

definitions.definition: A blow with an axe, cleaver, or similar utensil.
definitions.example: It should take just one good chop to fell the sapling.

definitions.definition: A blow delivered with the hand rigid and outstretched.
definitions.example: A karate chop.

definitions.definition: Ocean waves, generally caused by wind, distinguished from swell by being smaller and not lasting as long.
A hand where two or more players have an equal-valued hand, resulting in the chips being shared equally between them.
definitions.example: With both players having an ace-high straight, the pot was a chop.

definitions.definition: (with "the") Termination, especially from employment; the sack.
A woodchopping competition.
A crack or cleft; a chap.
To cut into pieces with short, vigorous cutting motions.
definitions.example: chop wood; chop an onion

definitions.definition: To sever with an axe or similar implement.
definitions.example: Chop off his head.

definitions.definition: To give a downward cutting blow or movement, typically with the side of the hand.
To hit the ball downward so that it takes a high bounce.
To divide the pot (or tournament prize) between two or more players.
To make a quick, heavy stroke or a series of strokes, with or as with an ax.
To do something suddenly with an unexpected motion; to catch or attempt to seize.
To interrupt; with in or out.
(Perl) To remove the final character from (a text string).
A turn of fortune; change; a vicissitude.
To exchange, to barter; to swap.
To chap or crack.
To vary or shift suddenly.
definitions.example: The wind chops about.

definitions.definition: To twist words.
To converse, discuss, or speak with another.
(chiefly in the plural) A jaw of an animal.
A movable jaw or cheek, as of a vice.
The land at each side of the mouth of a river, harbour, or channel.
definitions.example: East Chop; West Chop

definitions.definition: An official stamp or seal, as in China and India.
A mark indicating nature, quality, or brand.
definitions.example: silk of the first chop

definitions.definition: A license or passport that has been sealed.
A complete shipment.
definitions.example: a chop of tea

definitions.definition: An IRC channel operator.
A pronged connecting device which fits into a mating socket, especially an electrical one.
definitions.example: I pushed the plug back into the electrical socket and the lamp began to glow again.

definitions.definition: Any piece of wood, metal, or other substance used to stop or fill a hole.
definitions.example: Pull the plug out of the tub so it can drain.

definitions.definition: A flat oblong cake of pressed tobacco.
definitions.example: He preferred a plug of tobacco to loose chaw.

definitions.definition: A high, tapering silk hat.
A worthless horse.
definitions.example: That sorry old plug is ready for the glue factory!

definitions.definition: Any worn-out or useless article.
A block of wood let into a wall to afford a hold for nails.
A mention of a product (usually a book, film or play) in an interview, or an interview which features one or more of these.
definitions.example: During the interview, the author put in a plug for his latest novel.

definitions.definition: A body of once molten rock that hardened in a volcanic vent. Usually round or oval in shape.
definitions.example: Pressure built beneath the plug in the caldera, eventually resulting in a catastrophic explosion of pyroclastic shrapnel and ash.

definitions.definition: A type of lure consisting of a rigid, buoyant or semi-buoyant body and one or more hooks.
definitions.example: The fisherman cast the plug into a likely pool, hoping to catch a whopper.

definitions.definition: A small seedling grown in a tray from expanded polystyrene or polythene filled usually with a peat or compost substrate.
(jewellery) A short cylindrical piece of jewellery commonly worn in larger-gauge body piercings, especially in the ear.
A drug dealer.
A branch from a water-pipe to supply a hose.
To stop with a plug; to make tight by stopping a hole.
definitions.example: He attempted to plug the leaks with some caulk.

definitions.definition: To blatantly mention a particular product or service as if advertising it.
definitions.example: The main guest on the show just kept plugging his latest movie: it got so tiresome.

definitions.definition: To persist or continue with something.
definitions.example: Keep plugging at the problem until you find a solution.

definitions.definition: To shoot a bullet into something with a gun.
To have sex with, penetrate sexually.
definitions.example: I'd love to plug him.

definitions.definition: To create or recite a list.
To place in listings.
To sew together, as strips of cloth, so as to make a show of colours, or to form a border.
To cover with list, or with strips of cloth; to put list on; to stripe as if with list.
definitions.example: to list a door

definitions.definition: To plough and plant with a lister.
To prepare (land) for a cotton crop by making alternating beds and alleys with a hoe.
To cut away a narrow strip, as of sapwood, from the edge of.
definitions.example: to list a board

definitions.definition: To enclose (a field, etc.) for combat.
To engage a soldier, etc.; to enlist.
To engage in public service by enrolling one's name; to enlist.
To listen.
To listen to.
To be pleasing to.
To desire, like, or wish (to do something).
To cause (something) to tilt to one side.
definitions.example: the steady wind listed the ship

definitions.definition: To tilt to one side.
definitions.example: the ship listed to port

definitions.definition: The action of the verb to list.
An entry in a list or directory.
definitions.example: Aardvaark Plumbing is the first listing in Yellow Pages.

definitions.definition: A printout of a program or data set.
definitions.example: Print me a listing of the latest version.

definitions.definition: A physical manifestation of a single item in a list.
definitions.example: Please pass me the second listing for the two-story house, from that stack.

definitions.definition: The act of ploughing with a lister.
As listed or shown on a listing.
definitions.example: What is this house's listing price?

definitions.definition: A tapering cylindrical pin or peg used to stop the vent in a cask.
A device used to dispense liquids.
definitions.example: We don't have bottled water; you'll have to get it from the tap.

definitions.definition: Liquor drawn through a tap; hence, a certain kind or quality of liquor.
definitions.example: a liquor of the same tap

definitions.definition: A place where liquor is drawn for drinking.
A device used to cut an internal screw thread. (External screw threads are cut with a die.)
definitions.example: We drilled a hole and then cut the threads with the proper tap to match the valve's thread.

definitions.definition: A connection made to an electrical or fluid conductor without breaking it.
definitions.example: The system was barely keeping pressure due to all of the ill-advised taps along its length.

definitions.definition: An interception of communication by authority.
A device used to listen in secretly on telephone calls.
A procedure that removes fluid from a body cavity.
definitions.example: abdominal tap

definitions.definition: To furnish with taps.
definitions.example: If we tap the maple trees, we can get maple syrup!

definitions.definition: To draw off liquid from a vessel.
definitions.example: He tapped a new barrel of beer.

definitions.definition: To deplete, especially of a liquid via a tap; to tap out.
To exploit.
definitions.example: Businesses are trying to tap the youth market.

definitions.definition: To place a listening or recording device on a telephone or wired connection.
definitions.example: They can't tap the phone without a warrant.

definitions.definition: To intercept a communication without authority.
definitions.example: He was known to tap cable television.

definitions.definition: To cut an internal screw thread.
definitions.example: Tap an M3 thread all the way through the hole.

definitions.definition: To turn or flip a card or playing piece to remind players that it has already been used that turn (by analogy to "tapping," in the sense of drawing on to the point of temporary exhaustion, the resources or abilities represented by the card).
To cadge, borrow or beg.
definitions.example: I tried to tap a cigarette off him, but he wouldn't give me one.

definitions.definition: To drain off fluid by paracentesis.
To advance someone for a post or job, or for membership of a club.
definitions.example: Trump interviewed Mueller for FBI job day before he was tapped for special counsel.

definitions.definition: A gentle or slight blow; a light rap; a pat.
definitions.example: When Steve felt a tap on his shoulder, he turned around.

definitions.definition: The act of touching a touch screen.
A piece of leather fastened upon the bottom of a boot or shoe in repairing or renewing the sole or heel.
A signal, by drum or trumpet, for extinguishing all lights in soldiers' quarters and retiring to bed; usually given about a quarter of an hour after tattoo.
A consonant sound made by a single muscle contraction, such as the sound [ɾ] in the standard American English pronunciation of body.
To strike lightly.
definitions.example: She tapped him on the shoulder to get his attention.

definitions.definition: To touch one's finger, foot, or other body parts on a surface (usually) repeatedly.
definitions.example: He was so nervous he began to tap his fingers on the table.

definitions.definition: To make a sharp noise.
definitions.example: The tree, swaying in the breeze, began to tap on the window pane.

definitions.definition: To operate an electronic device (e.g. a mobile phone) by tapping a specific place on its (capacitive or other) touch screen.
To designate for some duty or for membership, as in 'a tap on the shoulder'.
To have sexual intercourse with.
definitions.example: I would tap that hot girl over there.

definitions.definition: To submit to an opponent by tapping one's hand repeatedly.
To force (an opponent) to submit.
To put a new sole or heel on.
definitions.example: to tap shoes

definitions.definition: A rhythmic dance in which the heels and toes of the dancer's shoes make a series of clicks
An Indian malarial fever.
The process of bringing an object back to its original state; the process of restoring something.
definitions.example: The restoration of this medieval church involved undoing all the Victorian modifications.

definitions.definition: The return of a former monarchy or monarch to power, usually after having been forced to step down.
definitions.example: The restoration of the House of Stuart took place a few years after the death of Cromwell.

definitions.definition: The receiving of a sinner to divine favor.
The act of submitting or yielding; surrender.
The act of submitting or giving e.g. a completed piece of work.
definitions.example: Any submissions received after Friday will have marks deducted for lateness.

definitions.definition: The thing which has been submitted.
A submission hold in wrestling, mixed martial arts, or other combat sports.
A subset or component of a mission.
Something that has been isolated.
To set apart or cut off from others.
To place in quarantine or isolation.
To separate a substance in pure form from a mixture.
To insulate, or make free of external influence.
To separate a pure strain of bacteria etc. from a mixed culture.
To insulate an electrical component from a source of electricity.
The act of preventing or hindering; obstruction of action, access, or approach; thwarting.
definitions.example: a fire prevention campaign

definitions.definition: Any measure intended to limit health-related risks (such as information campaigns, vaccination, early diagnosis etc.).
The act of going, or state of being, before.
Anticipation; especially, anticipation of needs, wishes, hazards and risks
Precaution; forethought.
Someone who provides therapy, usually professionally.
A building used to grow plants, particularly one with large glass windows or plastic sheeting to trap heat from sunlight even in intemperate seasons or climates.
The glass of a plane's cockpit.
A structure that shields the operating table to protect against bacteria.
A hot state in global climate.
To place (plants) in a greenhouse.
To nurture in order to promote growth.
The portion of the upper human appendage, from the shoulder to the wrist and sometimes including the hand.
definitions.example: She stood with her right arm extended and her palm forward to indicate “Stop!”

definitions.definition: The extended portion of the upper limb, from the shoulder to the elbow.
definitions.example: The arm and forearm are parts of the upper limb in the human body.

definitions.definition: A limb, or locomotive or prehensile organ, of an invertebrate animal.
definitions.example: the arms of an octopus

definitions.definition: A long, narrow, more or less rigid part of an object extending from the main part or centre of the object, such as the arm of an armchair, a crane, a pair of spectacles or a pair of compasses.
definitions.example: The robot arm reached out and placed the part on the assembly line.

definitions.definition: A bay or inlet off a main body of water.
definitions.example: Shelburne Bay is an arm of Lake Champlain.

definitions.definition: A branch of an organization.
definitions.example: the cavalry arm of the military service

definitions.definition: Power; might; strength; support.
definitions.example: the arm of the law

definitions.definition: A pitcher
definitions.example: The team needs to sign another arm in the offseason.

definitions.definition: One of the two parts of a chromosome.
A group of patients in a medical trial.
To take by the arm; to take up in one's arms.
Poor; lacking in riches or wealth.
To be pitied; pitiful; wretched.
(usually used in the plural) A weapon.
(in the plural) Heraldic bearings or insignia.
definitions.example: The Duke's arms were a sable gryphon rampant on an argent field.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) War; hostilities; deeds or exploits of war.
To supply with armour or (later especially) weapons.
definitions.example: The king armed his knights with swords and shields.

definitions.definition: To prepare a tool or a weapon for action; to activate.
definitions.example: Remember to arm the alarm system before leaving for work.

definitions.definition: To cover or furnish with a plate, or with whatever will add strength, force, security, or efficiency.
definitions.example: to arm the hit of a sword; to arm a hook in angling

definitions.definition: To furnish with means of defence; to prepare for resistance; to fortify, in a moral sense.
To take up weapons; to arm oneself.
To fit (a magnet) with an armature.
To make something holy by religious rite, sanctify.
To make the sign of the cross upon, so as to sanctify.
To invoke divine favor upon.
To honor as holy, glorify; to extol for excellence.
To esteem or account happy; to felicitate.
To wave; to brandish.
(past tense only blessed) To turn (a reference) into an object.
(with from) To secure, defend, or prevent from.
Some kind of divine or supernatural aid, or reward.
A pronouncement invoking divine aid.
Good fortune.
A modern pagan ceremony.
The act of declaring or bestowing favor; approval.

definitions.definition: Something someone is glad of.
definitions.example: After two weeks of sun, last night's rainfall was a blessing.

definitions.definition: A prayer before a meal; grace.
A group of unicorns.
A small dwelling characteristic of the frontier, especially when built from logs with simple tools and not constructed by professional builders, but by those who meant to live in it.
definitions.example: Abraham Lincoln was born in a log cabin.

definitions.definition: A chalet or lodge, especially one that can hold large groups of people.
A private room on a ship.

definitions.definition: The interior of a boat, enclosed to create a small room, particularly for sleeping.
The passenger area of an airplane.
(travel) The section of a passenger plane having the same class of service.
A signal box.
A small room; an enclosed place.
(Indian English) A private office; particularly of a doctor, businessman, lawyer, or other professional.
To place in a cabin or other small space.
(by extension) To limit the scope of.
To live in, or as if in, a cabin; to lodge.
An object used to mark a location.
Someone or something that marks.
A real or virtual objective, something to be aimed for.
A felt-tipped pen.

definitions.definition: Marks of ink left by this type of pen.
definitions.example: Susie has gotten marker all over the walls, and it looks dreadful.

definitions.definition: A signed note of a debt to be paid.
A nonmonetary debt owed to someone, especially in return for a favor.

definitions.definition: A device that fires a paintball.
A defending player who stays close to an opponent in order to mark them.
A player employed by a private club and available to compete against members.
A gene or DNA sequence with a known location on a chromosome that can be used to identify individuals or species.
A recognition given by a competition authority that a company is the first to approach it to reveal the existence of a cartel, as a prelude to a formal application for leniency for the company.
To mark or write on (something) using a marker
A drama or similar work, in which the main character is brought to ruin or otherwise suffers the extreme consequences of some tragic flaw or weakness of character.
The genre of such works, and the art of producing them.
A disastrous event, especially one involving great loss of life or injury.
Involving a full amount of time spent on some activity, especially a job.

definitions.definition: Spending a full amount of time.
definitions.example: to work full-time

definitions.definition: A dwelling; habitation; building.
Courageous, daring.
definitions.example: Bold deeds win admiration and, sometimes, medals.

definitions.definition: Visually striking; conspicuous.
definitions.example: the painter's bold use of colour and outline

definitions.definition: (of typefaces) Having thicker strokes than the ordinary form of the typeface.
definitions.example: The last word of this sentence is bold.

definitions.definition: Presumptuous, forward or impudent.
Naughty; insolent; badly-behaved.
definitions.example: All of her children are terribly bold and never do as they are told.

definitions.definition: Full-bodied.
Pornographic; depicting nudity.
Steep or abrupt.
To make (a font or some text) bold.
To make bold or daring.
To become bold.
A reflected sound that is heard again by its initial observer.
An utterance repeating what has just been said.
A device in verse in which a line ends with a word which recalls the sound of the last word of the preceding line.
Sympathetic recognition; response; answer.
The displaying on the command line of the command that has just been executed.
The letter E in the ICAO spelling alphabet.

(whist) A signal, played in the same manner as a trump signal, made by a player who holds four or more trumps (or, as played by some, exactly three trumps) and whose partner has led trumps or signalled for trumps.
(whist) A signal showing the number held of a plain suit when a high card in that suit is led by one's partner.
(of a sound or sound waves) To reflect off a surface and return.
To reflect back (a sound).
(by extension) To repeat (another's speech, opinion etc.).

definitions.definition: To repeat its input as input to some other device or system.
(whist) To give the echo signal, informing one's partner about cards one holds.
The visual image formed by an echocardiograph.
The use of ultrasound to produce images of the heart.
To take possession of as a right (especially in Biblical translations).
definitions.example: Your descendants will inherit the earth.

definitions.definition: To receive (property, a title, etc.), by legal succession or bequest after the previous owner's death.
definitions.example: After Grandad died, I inherited the house.

definitions.definition: To receive a characteristic from one's ancestors by genetic transmission.
definitions.example: Let's hope the baby inherits his mother's looks and his father's intelligence.

definitions.definition: To derive from people or conditions previously in force.
definitions.example: This country has inherited an invidious class culture.

definitions.definition: To come into an inheritance.
definitions.example: Lucky old Daniel – his grandfather died rich, and he's inherited.

definitions.definition: To derive (existing functionality) from a superclass.
definitions.example: ModalWindow inherits all the properties and methods of Window.

definitions.definition: To derive a new class from (a superclass).
To put in possession of.
Intentional causing of somebody's experiencing agony
definitions.example: In every war there are acts of torture that cause the world to shudder.

definitions.definition: The "suffering of the heart" imposed by one on another, as in personal relationships
definitions.example: Coventry City midfielder Josh Ruffels described his 11 months out injured as 'absolute torture' after the goalless draw with Derby County Under-21s. (http//www.ccfc.co.uk/news/article/eleven-months-of-absolute-torture-760652.aspx)

definitions.definition: (often as "absolute torture") stage fright, severe embarrassment
To intentionally inflict severe pain or suffering on (someone).
definitions.example: In the aftermath of 9/11, we did some things that were wrong. We did a whole lot of things that were right, but, we tortured some folks. We did some things that were contrary to our values.

definitions.definition: A person with the official task of overseeing the work of a person or group, or of other operations and activities.
A person who monitors someone to make sure they comply with rules or other requirements set for them.
In certain states, an elected member of the governing body for a county which is called the board of supervisors.
A process responsible for managing other processes.
The income returned by an investment.
The total income received from a given source.
All income generated for some political entity's treasury by taxation and other means.
The total sales; turnover.
The net income from normal business operations; net sales.
A return; something paid back.
To generate revenue.
To supply with revenue.
As a result or consequence of something.
definitions.example: He didn't wake up early. Consequently, he was late to work.

definitions.definition: (sequence) subsequently, following after in time or sequence.
To hold up; to lift on high; to elevate.
To keep erect; to support; to sustain; to keep from falling
To support by approval or encouragement, to confirm (something which has been questioned)
The quality of being sexual; that which is characterized or distinguished by sex.
Sexual activity; concern with, or interest in, sexual activity.
Sexual potency.
Sexual orientation.
Sexual identity, gender.
Land adjoining a non-flowing body of water, such as an ocean, lake or pond.

definitions.example: The passengers signed up for shore tours.

definitions.definition: To set on shore.
A prop or strut supporting the weight or flooring above it.
definitions.example: The shores stayed upright during the earthquake.

definitions.definition: (without up) To provide with support.
(usually with up) To reinforce (something at risk of failure).
definitions.example: The workers were shoring up the dock after part of it fell into the water.

definitions.definition: To cut, originally with a sword or other bladed weapon, now usually with shears, or as if using shears.
To remove the fleece from a sheep etc by clipping.
To deform because of forces pushing in opposite directions.
To transform by displacing every point in a direction parallel to some given line by a distance proportional to the point’s distance from the line.
To make a vertical cut in the coal.
To reap, as grain.
To deprive of property; to fleece.
(Obsolete except in Hiberno-English) A sewer.
To warn or threaten.
To offer.
A voluntary gift or contribution for a specific cause.

definitions.definition: The act of giving or bestowing; a grant.
An organ in the body that filters the blood, producing urine.
This organ (of an animal) cooked as food.
Constitution, temperament, nature, type, character, disposition. (usually used of people)
A waiter.
A measure of the mass of matter contained by a unit volume.
The ratio of one quantity, representing something of interest, to another quantity representing space, area, or extent in which the thing of interest is distributed.
definitions.example: The number of particles per unit volume of a specified volume can be considered to be the particle density for the specified volume.

definitions.definition: The probability that an outcome will fall into a given range, per unit of that range; the relative likelihood of possible values of a continuous random variable.
Stupidity; denseness.
Voluntary agreement or permission.
Unity or agreement of opinion, sentiment, or inclination.
Advice; counsel.
To express willingness, to give permission.
definitions.example: After reflecting a little bit, I've consented.

definitions.definition: To cause to sign a consent form.
To grant; to allow; to assent to.
To agree in opinion or sentiment; to be of the same mind; to accord; to concur.
An upward grade or slope.
An improved component or replacement item, usually applied to technology
definitions.example: With my phone company, I get a free upgrade every twelve months if I keep topping up 10 pounds a month.

definitions.definition: An improvement
definitions.example: The remarried couples among my friends often joked that their divorce and remarriage amounted to an upgrade.

definitions.definition: To improve, usually applied to technology, generally by complete replacement of one or more components
definitions.example: When you upgrade your standard of living, you become addicted to that standard of living.

definitions.definition: To replace with something better.
definitions.example: I had to upgrade my anti-virus software to protect my computer from the newer threats.

definitions.definition: To improve the equipment or furnishings of or services rendered to
definitions.example: They upgraded him to the latest model.

definitions.definition: To improve in condition or status.
definitions.example: She upgraded to a more successful husband.

definitions.definition: To replace a program with a later version of itself, a version having a higher version number or marketed under a more recent product name.
Up a slope or grade.
An amount of film or tape that has been used to record something.
definitions.example: The footage we shot at the riot yesterday got ruined.

definitions.definition: A measurement in feet.
Improper treatment or usage; application to a wrong or bad purpose; an unjust, corrupt or wrongful practice or custom.
definitions.example: All abuse, whether physical, verbal, psychological or sexual, is bad.

definitions.definition: Misuse; improper use; perversion.
A delusion; an imposture; misrepresentation; deception.
Coarse, insulting speech; abusive language; language that unjustly or angrily vilifies.
Catachresis.
Physical maltreatment; injury; cruel treatment.
Violation; defilement; rape; forcing of undesired sexual activity by one person on another, often on a repeated basis.

definitions.definition: To injure; to maltreat; to hurt; to treat with cruelty, especially repeatedly.
To attack with coarse language; to insult; to revile; malign; to speak in an offensive manner to or about someone; to disparage.
To imbibe a drug for a purpose other than it was intended; to intentionally take more of a drug than was prescribed for recreational reasons; to take illegal drugs habitually.

To give way; to succumb to a force.
To produce as return, as from an investment.

definitions.definition: To produce as a result.

definitions.definition: To produce a particular sound as the result of a sound law.

definitions.definition: (of a material specimen) To pass the material's yield point and undergo plastic deformation.
To admit to be true; to concede; to allow.
Payment; tribute.
A product; the quantity of something produced.

definitions.definition: The current return as a percentage of the price of a stock or bond.
Profit earned from an investment; return on investment.
The act of plunging or submerging
A dive, leap, rush, or pitch into (into water)

definitions.definition: A swimming pool
The act of pitching or throwing oneself headlong or violently forward, like an unruly horse
Heavy and reckless betting in horse racing; hazardous speculation
An immersion in difficulty, embarrassment, or distress; the condition of being surrounded or overwhelmed; a strait; difficulty
To thrust into liquid, or into any penetrable substance; to immerse.

definitions.definition: To cast, stab or throw into some thing, state, condition or action.

definitions.definition: To baptize by immersion.
To dive, leap or rush (into water or some liquid); to submerge oneself.

definitions.definition: To fall or rush headlong into some thing, action, state or condition.

definitions.definition: To pitch or throw oneself headlong or violently forward, as a horse does.
To bet heavily and recklessly; to risk large sums in gambling.
To entangle or embarrass (mostly used in past participle).
To overwhelm, overpower.
To keep up, impose or bring into effect something, not necessarily by force.

definitions.definition: To give strength or force to; to affirm, to emphasize.

definitions.definition: To strengthen (a castle, town etc.) with extra troops, fortifications etc.
To intensify, make stronger, add force to.
To exert oneself, to try hard.
To compel, oblige (someone or something); to force.
To make or gain by force; to force.

definitions.definition: To put in motion or action by violence; to drive.
To give force to; to strengthen; to invigorate; to urge with energy.

definitions.definition: To urge; to ply hard; to lay much stress upon.
To prove; to evince.
The act or process of guiding.
Advice or counselling on some topic.

definitions.definition: Any process or system to control the path of a vehicle, missile etc.
Upright; vertical or reaching broadly upwards.
(of body parts) Rigid, firm; standing out perpendicularly, especially as the result of stimulation.
definitions.example: The penis should be fully erect before commencing copulation.

definitions.definition: (of a man) Having an erect penis
definitions.example: OK, baby, I'm erect now. Let's get it on!

definitions.definition: Bold; confident; free from depression; undismayed.
Directed upward; raised; uplifted.
Watchful; alert.
Elevated, as the tips of wings, heads of serpents, etc.
To put up by the fitting together of materials or parts.

definitions.definition: To cause to stand up or out.

definitions.definition: To lift up; to elevate; to exalt; to magnify.
To animate; to encourage; to cheer.
To cast or draw up (a figure of the heavens, horoscope etc.).
To set up as an assertion or consequence from premises, etc.
To set up or establish; to found; to form; to institute.
A shrub of the genus Rosa, with red, pink, white or yellow flowers.
A flower of the rose plant.
A plant or species in the rose family. (Rosaceae)
Something resembling a rose flower.
The rose flower, usually depicted with five petals, five barbs, and a circular seed.
A purplish-red or pink colour, the colour of some rose flowers.
A round nozzle for a sprinkling can or hose.
The base of a light socket.
Any of various large, red-bodied, papilionid butterflies of the genus Pachliopta.

To make rose-coloured; to redden or flush.
To perfume, as with roses.
Having a purplish-red or pink colour. See rosy.
To move, or appear to move, physically upwards relative to the ground.
To increase in value or standing.
To begin; to develop.
To go up; to ascend; to climb.

To come; to offer itself.
To be lifted, or capable of being lifted, from the imposing stone without dropping any of the type; said of a form.
A pale pink wine made by removing the dark grape skins at the required point during fermentation.
A farm owned by a collection of people
(especially in communist countries) one of more farms managed and owned, through the state, by the community
(grammar) a collective noun or name

Having plurality of origin or authority
(grammar) expressing a collection or aggregate of individuals, by a singular form

One who protects or supports; a defender or advocate.
An influential, wealthy person who supported an artist, craftsman, a scholar or a noble.
A customer, as of a certain store or restaurant.

One who has gift and disposition of a benefice.
A padrone.
A property owner, a landlord, a master. (Compare patroon.)
To be a patron of; to patronize; to favour.
To treat as a patron.
A minister of the highest rank sent to a foreign court to represent there his sovereign or country. (Sometimes called ambassador-in-residence)
An official messenger and representative.
A corporate representative, often the public face of the company.
definitions.example: As front hall porter, you are an ambassador for the hotel.

definitions.definition: (physical) Movement; that which moves or is moved.
The act or motion of drifting; the force which impels or drives; an overpowering influence or impulse.
A place (a ford) along a river where the water is shallow enough to permit crossing to the opposite side.
The tendency of an act, argument, course of conduct, or the like; object aimed at or intended; intention; hence, also, import or meaning of a sentence or discourse; aim.
The horizontal thrust or pressure of an arch or vault upon the abutments.
(handiwork) A tool.
A deviation from the line of fire, peculiar to oblong projectiles.
Minor deviation of audio or video playback from its correct speed.
The situation where a performer gradually and unintentionally moves from their proper location within the scene.
A passage driven or cut between shaft and shaft; a driftway; a small subterranean gallery; an adit or tunnel.
Movement.
A sideways movement of the ball through the air, when bowled by a spin bowler.
Slow, cumulative change.
definitions.example: genetic drift

definitions.definition: To move slowly, especially pushed by currents of water, air, etc.
definitions.example: The balloon was drifting in the breeze.

definitions.definition: To move haphazardly without any destination.
definitions.example: He drifted from town to town, never settling down.

definitions.definition: To deviate gently from the intended direction of travel.
definitions.example: This car tends to drift left at high speeds.

definitions.definition: To drive or carry, as currents do a floating body.
To drive into heaps.

definitions.definition: To accumulate in heaps by the force of wind; to be driven into heaps.
definitions.example: Snow or sand drifts.

definitions.definition: To make a drift; to examine a vein or ledge for the purpose of ascertaining the presence of metals or ores; to follow a vein; to prospect.
To enlarge or shape, as a hole, with a drift.
To oversteer a vehicle, causing loss of traction, while maintaining control from entry to exit of a corner. See Drifting (motorsport).
The place where someone works.
The minutes, or official record, of a negotiation or transaction; especially a document drawn up officially which forms the legal basis for subsequent agreements based on it.
An official record of a diplomatic meeting or negotiation; later specifically, a draft document setting out agreements to be signed into force by a subsequent formal treaty.
An amendment to an official treaty.
The first leaf of a roll of papyrus, or the official mark typically found on such a page.
The official formulas which appeared at the beginning or end of certain official documents such as charters, papal bulls etc.
The original notes of observations made during an experiment; also, the precise method for carrying out or reproducing a given experiment.
The official rules and guidelines for heads of state and other dignitaries, governing accepted behaviour in relations with other diplomatic representatives or over affairs of state.

A set of formal rules describing how to transmit or exchange data, especially across a network.

To make a protocol of.
To make or write protocols, or first drafts; to issue protocols.

A document certifying that a motor vehicle meets certain standards of mechanical soundness and safety; a warrant of fitness.
A defender, a protector.
Underclay in a coal mine.
To protect, keep safe (from danger).
To give (someone) an assurance or guarantee (of something); also, with a double object: to guarantee (someone something).
To guarantee (something) to be (of a specified quality, value, etc.).
To guarantee as being true; (colloquially) to believe strongly.
definitions.example: That tree is going to fall, I’ll warrant.

definitions.definition: To authorize; to give (someone) sanction or warrant (to do something).
definitions.example: I am warranted to search these premises fully.

definitions.definition: To justify; to give grounds for.
definitions.example: Circumstances arose that warranted the use of lethal force.

definitions.definition: A device that has a helical function.
The motion of screwing something; a turn or twist to one side.
A prison guard.
An extortioner; a sharp bargainer; a skinflint.
An instructor who examines with great or unnecessary severity; also, a searching or strict examination of a student by an instructor.
Sexual intercourse; the act of screwing.
A casual sexual partner.
Salary, wages.
Backspin.
A small packet of tobacco.
An old, worn-out, unsound and worthless horse.

A straight line in space with which a definite linear magnitude termed the pitch is associated. It is used to express the displacement of a rigid body, which may always be made to consist of a rotation about an axis combined with a translation parallel to that axis.
An amphipod crustacean.
definitions.example: the skeleton screw (Caprella);  the sand screw

definitions.definition: (in the plural, with "the") Rheumatism.
To connect or assemble pieces using a screw.
To have sexual intercourse with.
To cheat someone or ruin their chances in a game or other situation.
To practice extortion upon; to oppress by unreasonable or extortionate exactions; to put the screws on.
To contort.
To miskick (a ball) by hitting it with the wrong part of the foot.
To screw back.
To examine (a student) rigidly; to subject to a severe examination.
A distinctive mark, token, sign, emblem or cognizance, worn on one's clothing, as an insignia of some rank, or of the membership of an organization.
definitions.example: the badge of a society; the badge of a policeman

definitions.definition: A small nameplate, identifying the wearer, and often giving additional information.
A card, sometimes with a barcode or magnetic strip, granting access to a certain area.
Something characteristic; a mark; a token.
(thieves' cant) A brand on the hand of a thief, etc.
definitions.example: He has got his badge, and piked: He was burned in the hand, and is at liberty.

definitions.definition: A carved ornament on the stern of a vessel, containing a window or the representation of one.
A distinctive mark worn by servants, retainers, and followers of royalty or nobility, who, being beneath the rank of gentlemen, have no right to armorial bearings.
A small overlay on an icon that shows additional information about that item, such as the number of new alerts or messages.
An icon or emblem awarded to a user for some achievement.
definitions.example: When you have checked in to the site from ten different cities, you unlock the Traveller badge.

definitions.definition: To mark or distinguish with a badge.
definitions.example: The television was badged as 'GE', but wasn't made by them.

definitions.definition: To show a badge to.
definitions.example: He calmed down a lot when the policeman badged him.

definitions.definition: To enter a restricted area by showing one's badge.
The art of criticism.
An essay in which another piece of work is criticised, reviewed, etc.
A point made to criticize something.
definitions.example: Bob liked most of my presentation, but offered three minor critiques.

definitions.definition: A critic; one who criticises.
To review something.
definitions.example: I want you to critique this new idea of mine.

definitions.definition: Used loosely, a tentative conjecture explaining an observation, phenomenon or scientific problem that can be tested by further observation, investigation and/or experimentation. As a scientific term of art, see the attached quotation. Compare to theory, and quotation given there.
(general) An assumption taken to be true for the purpose of argument or investigation.
(grammar) The antecedent of a conditional statement.
A governmental body with the power to make, amend and repeal laws.
A legislative building.
The act of coming forth.
The number of people who attend or participate in an event (especially an election) or are present at a venue.
A place to pull off a road.
definitions.example: When towing a trailer, use the turnouts to let faster traffic pass.

definitions.definition: A place where moveable rails allow a train to switch tracks; a set of points.
A quitting of employment for the purpose of forcing increase of wages; a strike.
A striker.
That which is prominently brought forward or exhibited; hence, an equipage.
definitions.example: A man with a showy carriage and horses is said to have a fine turnout.

definitions.definition: Net quantity of produce yielded.
The act of resigning.
A written or oral declaration that one resigns.
State of uncomplaining acceptance in the face of something undesirable but unavoidable.
The form by which a vassal returns the feu into the hands of a superior.
The act of detaining or the state of being detained.
A temporary state of custody or confinement, especially of a prisoner awaiting trial, or of a student being punished.
The bare physical control without the mental element of intention required for possession.
The systematic killing of substantial numbers of people on the basis of their ethnicity, religion, political beliefs, social status, or other particularities.
definitions.example: A genocide will always be followed by the denial that it ever happened.

definitions.definition: (by extension) The systematic suppression of ideas on the basis of cultural or ethnic origin; culturicide.
The elimination of an entire class of monsters by the player.
To commit genocide (against); to eliminate (a group of people) completely.
To invite (someone) to take part in a competition.
definitions.example: We challenged the boys next door to a game of football.

definitions.definition: To dare (someone).
To dispute (something).
definitions.example: to challenge the accuracy of a statement or of a quotation

definitions.definition: To make a formal objection to a juror.
To claim as due; to demand as a right.
To censure; to blame.
To question or demand the countersign from (one who attempts to pass the lines).
definitions.example: The sentinel challenged us with "Who goes there?"

definitions.definition: To object to the reception of the vote of, e.g. on the ground that the person is not qualified as a voter.
To take (a final exam) in order to get credit for a course without taking it.
The act of making a challenge.
Difficult, hard to do.
In a hopeful manner.
It is hoped that; I hope; we hope.
definitions.example: Hopefully, my father will arrive in time for the show.

definitions.definition: A person who is actively engaged in battle, conflict or warfare; a soldier or combatant.
A person who is aggressively, courageously, or energetically involved in an activity, such as athletics.
A scheme for the distribution of prizes by lot or chance, especially a gaming scheme in which one or more tickets bearing particular numbers draw prizes, the other tickets are blanks.
An affair of chance.
(Shakespeare) Allotment; a thing allotted.
A push from behind, as to one who is endeavoring to climb.
Something that helps, or adds power or effectiveness; assistance.
definitions.example: The controversy gave a boost to the author's sales.

definitions.definition: (automotive engineering) A positive intake manifold pressure in cars with turbochargers or superchargers.
To lift or push from behind (one who is endeavoring to climb); to push up.
(by extension) To help or encourage (something) to increase or improve; to assist in overcoming obstacles.
definitions.example: This campaign will boost your chances of winning the election.

definitions.definition: To steal.
To jump-start a vehicle by using cables to connect the battery in a running vehicle to the battery in a vehicle that won't start.
To give a booster shot to.
To amplify; to signal boost.
The moral sense of right and wrong, chiefly as it affects one's own behaviour.
definitions.example: Your conscience is your highest authority.

definitions.definition: (chiefly fiction) A personification of the moral sense of right and wrong, usually in the form of a person, a being or merely a voice that gives moral lessons and advices.
Consciousness; thinking; awareness, especially self-awareness.
The joining together of multiple sources.
definitions.example: The merge of the two documents failed.

definitions.definition: To combine into a whole.
definitions.example: Headquarters merged the operations of the three divisions.

definitions.definition: To combine into a whole.
definitions.example: The two companies merged.

definitions.definition: To blend gradually into something else.
definitions.example: The lanes of traffic merged.

definitions.definition: An advancement in rank or position.
definitions.example: I'll have to give myself a promotion!

definitions.definition: Dissemination of information in order to increase its popularity.
definitions.example: the promotion of the idea of global warming in schools

definitions.definition: An event intended to increase the reach or image of a product or brand.
definitions.example: The price cut is serving as a promotion of the manufacturer's new beverage varieties.

definitions.definition: Forward motion. (Contrast remotion.)
A physical or photographic queue of people allegedly involved in a crime, allowing a witness to identify them
A line of people or vehicles, in which the individual at the front end is dealt with first, the one behind is dealt with next, and so on, and in which newcomers join at the end; a queue.
Collectively, the members of a team.
definitions.example: The manager fielded his strongest lineup for the game against United.

definitions.definition: The batting order.
The members of a music group at any one time.
The acts performing at a concert or music festival.
The academic staff at schools, colleges, universities or not-for-profit research institutes, as opposed to the students or support staff.
A division of a university.
definitions.example: She transferred from the Faculty of Science to the Faculty of Medicine.

definitions.definition: An ability, skill, or power, often plural.
definitions.example: He lived until he reached the age of 90 with most of his faculties intact.

definitions.definition: A power, authority or privilege conferred by a higher authority.
(Church of England) A licence to make alterations to a church.
The members of a profession.
Striving; earnest endeavor; hard work.
Exertion or contention for superiority, either by physical or intellectual means.
Bitter conflict, sometimes violent.
A trouble of any kind.
That which is contended against; occasion of contest.
To incapacitate; especially by inducing disorientation or unconsciousness.
definitions.example: Bill tried to stun the snake by striking it on the head.

definitions.definition: To shock or surprise.
definitions.example: He stood there stunned, looking at the beautiful, breath-taking sunrise.

definitions.definition: To hit the cue ball so that it slides without topspin or backspin (and with or without sidespin) and continues at a natural angle after contact with the object ball
Having an effect that stuns.
definitions.example: The stunning jolt from the taser gun made the criminal stop fleeing.

definitions.definition: Exceptionally beautiful or attractive.
definitions.example: That woman is stunning!

definitions.definition: Amazing; wonderfully good.
definitions.example: The film was stunning.

definitions.definition: The act by which a person or animal is physically stunned.
Government by bureaus or their administrators or officers.

(organizational theory) A system of administration based upon organisation into bureaus, division of labour, a hierarchy of authority, etc., designed to dispose of a large body of work in a routine manner.
definitions.example: At that time the administration replaced the system of patronage in the civil service with a bureaucracy.

definitions.definition: The body of officers and administrators, especially of a government.
definitions.example: The bureaucracy is expanding to meet the needs of the expanding bureaucracy. (apocryphal quip)

definitions.definition: Excessive red tape and routine in any administration, body or behaviour.
definitions.example: The head of the civil service promised to clamp down on bureaucracy.

definitions.definition: Fine champagne; French brandy.
(usually in the plural) Something that is fine; fine particles.
definitions.example: They filtered silt and fines out of the soil.

definitions.definition: To make finer, purer, or cleaner; to purify or clarify.
definitions.example: to fine gold

definitions.definition: To become finer, purer, or cleaner.
To make finer, or less coarse, as in bulk, texture, etc.
definitions.example: to fine the soil

definitions.definition: To change by fine gradations.
definitions.example: to fine down a ship's lines, i.e. to diminish her lines gradually

definitions.definition: To clarify (wine and beer) by filtration.
To become gradually fine; to diminish; to dwindle (with away, down, or off).
Senses referring to subjective quality.
Senses referring to objective quality.
Behind the batsman and at a small angle to the line between the wickets.
definitions.example: [...] to nudge it through the covers (or tickle it down to fine leg) for a four [...]

definitions.definition: Subtle; thin; tenuous.
Expression of (typically) reluctant agreement.
Well, nicely, in a positive way.
definitions.example: Everything worked out fine.

definitions.definition: Finely; elegantly; delicately.
In a manner so that the driven ball strikes the object ball so far to one side as to be barely deflected, the object ball being driven to one side.
A fee levied as punishment for breaking the law.
definitions.example: The fine for jay-walking has gone from two dollars to thirty in the last fifteen years.

definitions.definition: To issue a fine as punishment to (someone).
definitions.example: She was fined a thousand dollars for littering, but she appealed.

definitions.definition: To pay a fine.
The end of a musical composition.
The location in a musical score that indicates the end of the piece, particularly when the piece ends somewhere in the middle of the score due to a section of the music being repeated.
End; conclusion; termination; extinction.
A final agreement concerning lands or rents between persons, as the lord and his vassal.
A sum of money or price paid for obtaining a benefit, favor, or privilege, as for admission to a copyhold, or for obtaining or renewing a lease.
To finish; to cease.
To cause to cease; to stop.
